titlepage.titleproper: A Guide to the Records of the Virginia Secretary of Administration, 2018-2021
titlepage.subtitle:
A Collection in
the Library of Virginia 53494

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Records of the Virginia Secretary of Administration, 2018-2021

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Privacy protected and confidential information is restricted from public access for 75 years per Code of Virginia 42.1-78. Privacy-protected information has been flagged and/or sealed, but not removed from the collection. Restricted information may include, but is not limited to: attorney-client privileged documents, medical information, and social security numbers.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Records of the Virginia Secretary of Administration, 2018-2021. Accessions 53494, State government records collection, The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Virginia.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Accession 53494 was transferred by the Office of the Secretary of Public Safety, 7 January 2022.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: In 1970, the Governor's Management Commission Study recommended the creation of six "Deputy Governors" to assist the Chief Executive in his managerial duties. Compatible functions of government were grouped under these administrative heads, who would serve as the Governor's top management team.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The Secretary of Administration records consists of XX archival boxes and are divided into X series. Series have been designated for Correspondence and subject files; Correspondence and subject files - Assigned State Agencies, Governor Decision Requests; and Environmental Impact Statements. These records document the activities of the Office of the Secretary of Administration, as well as the agencies and boards which fall under its heading, during the gubernatorial term Gov. Ralph Northam (2018-2022).

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged into the following series:

item.emph: Series I. Correspondence and Subject Files - Assigned State Agencies;
Series II. Correspondence and Subject Files - Secretary, 2018-2021;

did.unittitle: Series I. Correspondence and Subject Files - Assigned State Agencies, 2018-2021.

scopecontent.p: Correspondence and Subject Files - Assigned State Agencies, 2018-201721, is housed in XX archival boxes and is arranged alphabetically by agency. This series contains topical files and correspondence with the following agencies and boards that operated under the Secretary of Public Safety and Homeland Security:

The correspondence and subject files contain correspondence between the agencies and the Office of the Secretary of Administration regarding issues that affect that particular agency or board. References to budgetary matters, litigation, studies and reports, board appointments, and legislation are frequently found in this material. These files may also provide supporting documentation and background information on many topics and include agendas, briefings, minutes, plans, presentations, proposals, publications, reports, and studies.

Some topics include agency accomplishments, budget issues, correctional facilities, healthcare and mental health services, hurricane planning and preparedness (VDEM), initial briefings, legislative initiatives and presentations, parole, restrictive housing, school and campus safety, and unmanned aircraft systems, as well as records related to the Advisory Committee on Virginia ABC Information Technology Systems (ABC), Law Enforcement Expert Panel Review (ABC), Board of Corrections (DOC), Evidence Based Decision Making Initiative (DCJS), and Governor's Commission on Parole Review (VPB).

Series II. Correspondence and Subject Files - Office of the Secretary, 2018-2021.

scopecontent.p: Correspondence and subject files - Office of the Secretary, 2018-2021, is housed in XX boxes and is arranged alphabetically. Contains incoming correspondence, some outgoing correspondence, invitations and topical files of Secretary Moran. Includes correspondence from local, state and federal government officials, officials from other states, business owners, commissions, authorities and associations, as well as constituent correspondence. Topics include agency head meetings, agency updates, domestic violence, emergency preparedness and coordination, federal agencies, guns, homeland security, immigration, interoperability, mental health, opioids, other state agencies, staff meetings. Files may include agendas, briefings, correspondence, financial statements, invitations, memoranda, presentations, publications, and reports.

did.unittitle: Savings and Efficiencies Stategies (FY 2021 and FY 2022), 2019

scopecontent.p: Governor Decsion Requests, 2018-2021, are housed in X archival boxes and are arranged chronologically. This series documents
